comments.purpose: Storage node; provides capacity and serves fragments, policy comes from origin
comments.onboarding: Template defaults should work: set node.name unique, adjust storage_port if needed, set fragments path + capacity_bytes, then start: python satellite.py. Cert/key auto-generated by origin (replace only on rotation)

network.advertised_ip: Optional: override detected IP if behind NAT; origin uses this to reach storage_port
network.listen_host: Bind address for storage RPCs (0.0.0.0 = all interfaces)
network.storage_port: Port for fragment uploads/downloads; must be reachable by satellites/origin

storage.capacity_bytes: Total space to expose for fragments (e.g., 1073741824 = 1 GiB). Set to 0 to drain
storage.fragments: Local path for fragment storage; ensure disk has capacity_bytes free

paths.cert: TLS cert issued/approved by origin (client/server auth)
paths.key: Private key for this storage node cert
paths.origin_pubkey: Origin public key for verifying control messages

sync.heartbeat_interval: Seconds between heartbeats to origin (advertises capacity and health)
sync.origin_pubkey_url: Where to fetch origin public key if missing
sync.list_json_url: Where to fetch trusted node registry if missing

comments.notes: Limits/placement/feeder API keys are centralized at origin; this node follows origin policy. Keep clock synced (NTP) for TLS validity.
